result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason A Craig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Conditions pertain to both counts:   Defendant to submit DNA sample. Complete anger management counseling. Six month review.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Attorney Maura Melka
Filed by Attorney Maura Melka

Defendant Jason A Craig in court with attorney Maura O'Connell Melka.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading waived on Amended Information.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1&2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 18 months probation on each count. $443 & $243 costs. Complete anger management counseling. Six month review. Submit DNA sample.  Court granted 1 day jail credit.
Notice of hearing for p/s hrg on 6/8/16 to 232 Maple Street, Barbaboo, WI  returned marked moved.  No action taken.

records.addlTxt: with felony conds. and no unsupervised contact with juvenile J.C., no threats or acts of violence against J.C.

Defendant, Jason A Craig, appeared by video with Attorney Jeremiah Meyer O'Day, special for the public defender office. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading waived. $2,000 recog. bond with felony conds. and no unsupervised contact with juvenile J.C., no threats or acts of violence against J.C. Time limits waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
